org.team4159.boths.views

Class BidirectionalWebSocketView

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team4159.boths.View
      • org.team4159.boths.views.BaseWebSocketView
        • org.team4159.boths.views.BidirectionalWebSocketView

  • public class BidirectionalWebSocketView
extends BaseWebSocketView
    This class allows for individual processing of every WebSocket connection received in this view.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BidirectionalWebSocketView.BidirectionalWebSocket
      This class represents a socket which should be used to communicate with a WebSocket client.
      static interface  BidirectionalWebSocketView.Handler
      Handles bidirectional WebSocket sessions.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.team4159.boths.views.BaseWebSocketView

        BaseWebSocketView.Message

    • Constructor Detail

      • BidirectionalWebSocketView

        public BidirectionalWebSocketView()
        Creates a BidirectionalWebSocketView. Overwrite handleBidirectionalWebSocket(BidirectionalWebSocket) or use BidirectionalWebSocketView(Handler) to implement custom behavior.

      • BidirectionalWebSocketView

        public BidirectionalWebSocketView(BidirectionalWebSocketView.Handler handler)
        Creates a BidirectionalWebSocketView. handler will be used to handle each connection.
        Parameters:
        handler - Connection handler.

    • Method Detail

      • postResponse

        public void postResponse(Request req,
                Response res,
                java.io.InputStream is,
                java.io.OutputStream os)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: View
        Optionally continues handling the request after a response from View.getResponse(Request, Route) has been sent to the client. The default implementation does nothing.
        Overrides:
        postResponse in class View
        Parameters:
        req - The Request object of the initial request.
        res - The Response object as returned by View.getResponse(Request, Route).
        is - The raw InputStream of the socket.
        os - The raw OutputStream of the socket.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • handleBidirectionalWebSocket

        public void handleBidirectionalWebSocket(BidirectionalWebSocketView.BidirectionalWebSocket sock)
        The main loop of the WebSocket handler. Must return when sock.isOpen() starts returning false. The default implementation calls handleBidirectionalWebSocket(BidirectionalWebSocket) on the BidirectionalWebSocketView.Handler passed to the constructor.
        Parameters:
        sock - The BidirectionalWebSocketView.BidirectionalWebSocket used to communicate with the client.
